title: Apple Now Requires Games Offering Loot Boxes to Disclose Odds - IGN

embed.description: Odds must be disclosed to the consumer before purchase. Apple has revised its guidelines for iOS developers, requiring games with loot boxes to disclose the odds of attaining randomized digital goods to consumers before they shell out the cash.

body: The first leaves falling from the winds of change.

replies.body: Loot boxes need to be deleted, not just showing odd's, gambler's don't care that the odd's are against them, or consider their luck high enough not to matter.

Good. Did you know that there was basically fuck-all chance of re-rolling slin shards into anything more than a 750 RP skin until like 3 days ago??

Some guy figured it out by doing a week-long test on the PBE and posted his outrage on the NA forums and within a day Riot owned up to it and fixed it.

you used to be able to reroll shards and get anything.  so if what u say is true then it just shows how riot can and will chop and change chances/numbers whenever they want to. this time it got noticed.

they could tweak this quite easily but really it is a profit driven initiative on a dying population. They will just milk all they can.
What i dont understand is the eagerness of many people here to bend over.

I have never been a gambling man, as I was a math genius back in school (many years ago).

I know how odds work, and I know the 'house' always wins.
Payouts are always going to be less than the take, otherwise no one would do it.

And in cases where you can manipulate odds by being savvy, the house always either gets rid of you for doing so, or makes it so that you don't really know the real odds.

Everything is rigged against you from the start.
